description: The round payoff this round was 3. You, John chose to play option 1.Kate chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 0.

The game is a repeated strategic dilemma where each round’s round input (here, 3) sets the stakes, and the players must weigh the potential gains from unilateral deviation against the severe joint penalty if both choose the aggressive option.

In the recorded round (2024-01-02), both John and Kate chose the safe option 1, which illustrates a trust or risk‐aversion dynamic; neither wanted to risk the downside of mutual option 2 even though a unilateral option 2 play would have yielded a positive payoff equal to the input.

The payoff structure creates tensions between cooperation and exploitation. A player may be tempted to play option 2 to secure a payoff equal to the round input if confident that the opponent will choose option 1, but doing so carries the risk that if both choose option 2, both suffer an enormous negative payoff.
